intro: Cypholophus treubii var. aciculata, commonly known as the slender-leafed Cypholophus, is a climbing plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its elongated, needle-like leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in umbels. Its stems are often hairy and can twine around supports as it grows. It is often found in tropical rainforests, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments.
